description.value:
You gain the service of an otherworldly spirit, which manifests as a little animal in an unoccupied space of your choice within range. This creature uses the @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.actors.Actor.LydCUi8sS59J8zDf]{Crawling Claw} stat block.

Innate Spellcasting.

The claw's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At-will: @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.spells.Item.1mSmSMfpGVk5QyAT]{Mage Hand}

Undead Nature.

The claw does not require air to breathe, nor does it require food, drink, or sleep.

Combat.

The familiar is an ally to you and your companions. In combat, it shares your initiative and acts during your turn. It obeys your commands (no action required by you), but the familiar cannot attack unless you use your reaction on its turn to command it to do so.

Dismissing the Claw.

The claw instantaneously reappears on its leather cord if you dismiss it as an action, or if you die. Whenever the claw does so, it leaves anything it was wearing or carrying behind in its space.

Death of the Familiar.

If the claw is reduced to 0 hit points or destroyed, the claw shrivels and crumbles to dust and the leather cord will begin to regenerate the claw. The claw will be fully grown back and restored within 4d6 hours.

Remote Viewing.

As an action, you can see through your familiar's eyes and hear what it hears until the start of your next turn, gaining the benefits of any special senses that the familiar has. During this time, you are deafened and blinded with regard to your own senses.
